Issues.Title: Remove *I overloads and move scopes
Issues.Body:
Int overloads just cast to float, removing non-array ones to cut back on interop code.

- Fix some missing KeepAlives
- Move error handling for GdiPlus to Core
- Move some scopes down and convert RegionScope to use IPointer

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10640)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove *I overloads and move scopes" (#10640)

Issues.Title: Convert Region and Graphics to use CsWin32
Issues.Body:
Converts Region and Graphics to mostly use CsWin32 (modulo enumerating metafiles).

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10628)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Convert Region and Graphics to use CsWin32" (#10628)

Issues.Title: Ignore System.Private.Windows.Core in FileClassification
Issues.Body:
This helps with failures in https://github.com/dotnet/windowsdesktop/pull/4063. We want System.Private.Windows.Core to be in the runtime pack of the shared Framework, so this does not need to be omitted from FrameworkListFile

Issues.Title: Fixes #https://github.com/microsoft/winforms-designer/issues/5687. Corrects DataGridView's Sorted event description
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #https://github.com/microsoft/winforms-designer/issues/5687


## Proposed changes

- Corrects the DataGridView Sorted event description in Winforms's SR.resx

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- None

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/30190295/fa72a54a-3201-414c-ba11-ead8f3d5634b)


### After

![image (3)](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/30190295/5905a820-21a8-4dc2-9fee-dc8fb3058d91)

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual test

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->


 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- 9.0.100-alpha.1.23618.3 <!-- use `dotnet --info` -->


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.Title: [9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6] AutoVersionsDB app UI mess up when scrolling
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

```
.NET SDK:
 Version:           9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6
 Commit:            ca1439c8ae
 Workload version:  9.0.100-manifests.f3b52893

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.19044
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6\

.NET workloads installed:
 There are no installed workloads to display


Host:
  Version:      9.0.0-alpha.1.24054.18
  Architecture: x64
  Commit:       9325d3836d

.NET SDKs installed:
    9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 9.0.0-alpha.1.24055.3 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 9.0.0-alpha.1.24054.18 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 9.0.0-alpha.1.24055.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
```

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

yes

1. Windows10 21h2 x64 + dotnet-sdk-8.0.101: Pass
2. Windows10 21h2 x64 + dotnet-sdk-9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6: Fail

### Issue description

AutoVersionsDB UI is messed up when scrolling on dotnet-sdk-9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6. But there is no any exception thrown.

**Application Name:** AutoVersionsDB
**OS：** Windows 10 21H2
**CPU:** X64
**.NET Build Numbe**r: dotnet-sdk-9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6
**Checking the repro environment** at https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1938706

### Steps to reproduce

**The machine has dotnet-sdk-9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6 installed.**

1. Launch AutoVersionsDB.WinApp under C:\App\AutoVersionsDB.
2. Click "New Project" button.
3. Scroll the content.

**Expected Result:**
Window content will display normally.

**Actual Result:**
The content on Window is messed up.
![ReproSteps](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/83067197/e7c6d4da-05b6-46c6-b984-63f48d69f108)


@dotnet-actwx-bot @dotnet/compat
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6] AutoVersionsDB app UI mess up when scrolling" (#10630)

Issues.Title: added hash algorithm value to the assembly table in metadata for Accessibility.dll
Issues.Body:
Other .NET and .NET Framework assemblies have this value set to SHA1. And Accessibility.dll in .NET Framework has the same value. This issue is unlikely to cause any problems, it only looks inconsistent. Most likely we had overlooked this attribute when editing the IL when moving to Core.
Per @marklio this value is used for:
```
•	calculating the hashes for File table metadata. This is used in multi-file and multi-module assembly scenarios, which are rarer (multi-module basically only happens in System.EnterpriseServices and no where else, multi-file is more common, but isn't in play for Accessibility.dll)
•	Calculating the "strong name signature" data used in validating strong names. The content of the file is hashed with that algorithm and then signed with the private key and stored in these bytes, and can be validated using the public key that exists in the Assembly table. Without the algorithm, you can't validate the signature. I haven't validated whether the strong name signature is present and is a SHA1, but that is what I suspect (the strong name signature bytes are non-zero, which suggests that it is appropriately signed).
```

.NET9 before:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/15823268/e0def302-4181-40d6-b840-e1dc27621c79)

.NET Framework
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/15823268/f0b47eeb-176d-41d9-b2c8-3f606c41daed)

.NET 9 after
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/15823268/299da745-a075-4a45-9652-e6e58e43fa7b)


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10627)

Issues.Title: Rename scope files to match

Issues.Title: More interop cleanup
Issues.Body:
Some more interop cleanup in preparation of moving other Win32 interop to a shared model with System.Drawing.

- Add System and System.Collections.Generic to global usings for System.Drawing
- Move Libraries and NullHandle to Core
- Move scopes to Gdi32 namespace and out of PInvoke (necessary for now as we now have multiple PInvoke classes)
- Move COM related stuff to Com namespace


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10613)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "More interop cleanup" (#10613)

Issues.Title: The horizontal scrollbar is unnecessarily visible in the listbox at a 110 scaling in Winforms.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 7.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

NO

### Issue description

When using the listbox at a 110 scaling , the horizontal scrollbar is visible, whereas in 125 or 150 scaling, the horizontal scrollbar is not visible.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/121555390/991df866-0557-421a-80f0-2e3458ab650b)


### Steps to reproduce

Set the Screen scaling to 110
Add listbox into the form with HorizontalScrollbar property set to true
Run the Sample
Note that the HorizontalScrollbar will be visible
Now change the scaling to 125 OR 150 , Note that the HorizontalScrollbar will not be visible now
[HorizontalScrollBar.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13874386/HorizontalScrollBar.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The horizontal scrollbar is unnecessarily visible in the listbox at a 110 scaling in Winforms." (#10618)

Issues.Title: [9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6] HtmlDocument.Write() throw System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException (0x80020008): Bad variable type.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

```
.NET SDK:
 Version:           9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6
 Commit:            ca1439c8ae
 Workload version:  9.0.100-manifests.f3b52893

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.19044
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6\

.NET workloads installed:
 There are no installed workloads to display


Host:
  Version:      9.0.0-alpha.1.24054.18
  Architecture: x64
  Commit:       9325d3836d

.NET SDKs installed:
    9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 9.0.0-alpha.1.24055.3 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 9.0.0-alpha.1.24054.18 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 9.0.0-alpha.1.24055.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
```

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes
1. Windows10 21h2 x64 + dotnet-sdk-7.0.405: Pass
2. Windows10 21h2 x64 + dotnet-sdk-8.0.101： Pass
3. Windows10 21h2 x64 + dotnet-sdk-9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6: Fail

### Issue description

When calling ```HtmlDocument.Write()``` to write a HTML page on dotnet-sdk-9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6, it throws ```"System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException (0x80020008): Bad variable type"``` exception.

**Application Name**: Character-Builder-5
**OS**： Windows 10 21H2
**CPU**: X64
**.NET Build Number**: dotnet-sdk-9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6
**App or App source checking at:**  https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1936945

**Github link:** https://github.com/MalukuSeito/Character-Builder-5


### Steps to reproduce

**Minimal Repro steps (Demo attached):**
[BadVariableDemo.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13871376/BadVariableDemo.zip)

**The machine has dotnet-sdk-9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6 installed.**

​​1.Create a .NET 7 or .NET 8 WinForm project.
2. Add following code in Form1.cs file:
```
public Form1()
{
    InitializeComponent();
        
    WebBrowser webBrowser = new WebBrowser();
    string s = "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"utf-16\"?>\r\n<html>\r\n</html>";
    webBrowser.Navigate("about:blank");
    webBrowser.Document.Write(s);
}
```
4. Build the project.
5. Update the runtime config file to .NET 9 versions:
```
"frameworks": [
      {
        "name": "Microsoft.NETCore.App",
        "version": "9.0.0-alpha.1.24054.18"
      },
      {
        "name": "Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App",
        "version": "9.0.0-alpha.1.24055.1"
      }
    ],
```
7. Launch the app

**Expected Result:**
App launch successfully.

**Actual Result:**
App launch failed with Bad variable type exception.

**StackTrace:**
```
Exception Info: System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException (0x80020008): Bad variable type.

   at System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.ThrowExceptionForHR(Int32 errorCode, IntPtr errorInfo)
   at Windows.Win32.Foundation.HRESULT.ThrowOnFailure(IntPtr errorInfo)
   at System.Windows.Forms.HtmlDocument.Write(String text)
   at BadVariableDemo.Form1..ctor() in E:\Demos\BadVariableDemo\BadVariableDemo\Form1.cs:line 12
   at BadVariableDemo.Program.Main() in E:\Demos\BadVariableDemo\BadVariableDemo\Program.cs:line 14
```
@dotnet-actwx-bot @dotnet/compat
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6] HtmlDocument.Write() throw System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException (0x80020008): Bad variable type." (#10615)

Issues.Title: [9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6] WPF uses WinForm PropertyGrid Tooltip get "Adding the tip to the native ToolTip control did not succeed." exception
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

```
.NET SDK:
 Version:           9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6
 Commit:            ca1439c8ae
 Workload version:  9.0.100-manifests.f3b52893

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.19044
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6\

.NET workloads installed:
 There are no installed workloads to display


Host:
  Version:      9.0.0-alpha.1.24054.18
  Architecture: x64
  Commit:       9325d3836d

.NET SDKs installed:
    9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 9.0.0-alpha.1.24055.3 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 9.0.0-alpha.1.24054.18 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 9.0.0-alpha.1.24055.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
```

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes
1. Windows10 21h2 x64 + dotnet-sdk-7.0.405: Pass
2. Windows10 21h2 x64 + dotnet-sdk-8.0.101: Pass
3. Windows10 21h2 x64 + dotnet-sdk-9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6: Fail

### Issue description

When using WinForm PropertyGrid control in WPF app, the tooltip in PropertyGrid will throw "System.InvalidOperationException: Adding the tip to the native ToolTip control did not succeed." exception.

**Application Name**: AvalonEdit
**OS**： Windows 10 21H2
**CPU**: X64
**.NET Build Number**: dotnet-sdk-9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6
**App or App source checking at:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1936985
**Github Link:** https://github.com/icsharpcode/AvalonEdit

### Steps to reproduce

**Minimal Repro steps** (Demo attached [TooltipDemo.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13871438/TooltipDemo.zip)):
**The machine has dotnet-sdk-9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6 installed.**

​​1.Create a .NET 7 or .NET 8 WPF project.
2. Add ```<UseWindowsForms>true</UseWindowsForms> ```to project file:
```
 <PropertyGroup>
   <OutputType>WinExe</OutputType>
   <TargetFramework>net8.0-windows</TargetFramework>
   <Nullable>enable</Nullable>
   <ImplicitUsings>enable</ImplicitUsings>
   <UseWPF>true</UseWPF>
   <UseWindowsForms>true</UseWindowsForms>
 </PropertyGroup>
```
3. Add PropertyGrid control to MainWindow.xaml:
```
<Window x:Class="ToolTipsDemo.MainWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        xmlns:local="clr-namespace:ToolTipsDemo"
        xmlns:forms="clr-namespace:System.Windows.Forms;assembly=System.Windows.Forms"
        mc:Ignorable="d"
        Title="MainWindow" Height="450" Width="800">
    <Grid>
        <WindowsFormsHost Name="propertyGridHost">
            <forms:PropertyGrid x:Name="propertyGrid"/>
        </WindowsFormsHost>
       
    </Grid>
</Window>
```
4. Build the project.
5. Update the runtime config file to .NET 9 versions:
```
"frameworks": [
      {
        "name": "Microsoft.NETCore.App",
        "version": "9.0.0-alpha.1.24054.18"
      },
      {
        "name": "Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App",
        "version": "9.0.0-alpha.1.24055.1"
      }
    ],
```
6. Launch the app.
7. Move the mouse to "Alphabetical" button of PropertyGrid.

**Expected Result:**
Tooltip for "Alphabetical" button will appear.

**Actual Result:**
Exception window pops up:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/83067197/f6c351e7-2712-495d-8594-540ef76d767d)


**Findings:**

In WPF project, any controls that has tooltip in PropertyGrid will cause this exception.
In WPF project, default WPF controls, like a button, when adding tooltip for them, they are working as normal.
In WinForm project, the tooltip in PropertyGrid doesn't have this issue.

StackTrace:
```
System.InvalidOperationException: Adding the tip to the native ToolTip control did not succeed.
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.SetToolInfo(Control control, String caption)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Hide(IWin32Window win)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.UpdateToolTip(ToolStripItem item, Boolean refresh)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.HandleMouseLeave(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.HandleMouseLeave()
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.OnMouseLeave(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(HWND hWnd, MessageId msg, WPARAM wparam, LPARAM lparam)
```
@dotnet-actwx-bot @dotnet/compat
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[9.0.100-alpha.1.24055.6] WPF uses WinForm PropertyGrid Tooltip get "Adding the tip to the native ToolTip control did not succeed." exception" (#10614)
